ALLEGATION:
A foster parent was not given information or written notice as to why a youth was
removed from his home on 7/29/2021. He was told it was not due to the special
investigation that’s occurring related to his license.
INVESTIGATION:
On 8/2/2021 I reviewed the complaint document, which was a letter documented
from Attorney M, as Foster Parent A’s attorney. The letter was addressed to
Licensing Supervisor B, and Licensing Worker E of the Wayne County Department
of Health and Human Services (DHHS) North Central (NC), and the Division of Child
Welfare Licensing (DCWL). The letter indicated the following:
 Foster Parent A is seeking information concerning the status of his license
after a placement interruption without notice on Thursday, 7/29/2021.
 “Upon information and belief Foster Parent A was verbally informed that a
Rule 400.9207 Special Evaluation, effective 7/8/2021 has been initiated
against him. However, he has not received a description of the allegations in
writing or a date and time for his interview. “
 He also emailed a complaint on 7/29/2021, however, no one has
acknowledged receipt of his concern, responded to his status inquiry, or
provided information in writing as to why the placement was interrupted.
 Foster Parent A has been a foster parent for over a decade, and he handle
high level care, at risk youths. He wishes to remain in compliance and to
continue servicing children in foster care through the state of Michigan.
On 8/2/2021 and 8/4/2021 I spoke with Foster Parent A about this complaint. Foster
Parent A acknowledged the information in the complaint and reported the following:
 Youth 1 was initially in a shelter bed via his foster home, and Foster Care
Worker (FCW) C was making sure his home became a regular bed placement
for Youth 1.

3

 A children services person and the police came to his home on 7/28/2021 or
7/29/2021, (he was not certain of the date) around 8:00pm and removed
Youth 1 from his home. They did not tell him why Youth 1 was being
removed. They did not report there was a concern of abuse or neglect nor
that that was why Youth 1 was being removed. The police and the children
services person only said they were told to remove Youth 1 from Foster
Parent A’s foster home.
 The morning after Youth 1’s removal, he called FCW C, Youth 1’s foster care
worker. FCW C reported not knowing why Youth 1 was removed. FCW C
reported no one told her Youth 1 was being removed. FCW C reported she
had spoken with their licensing department a day or so prior to this removal,
and the licensing staff reported Youth 1 was in Foster Parent A’s home to
stay.
 He went to the agency later that day and contacted the foster care supervisor.
That supervisor did not know why Youth 1 was removed. FCW C and that
supervisor were reaching out to DHHS-NC’s licensing department for
answers.
 Sometime later in the day, after Youth 1’s removal, Licensing Supervisor B
called him and reported that an Ennis Center for Children staff person
reported that Foster Parent A, said Foster Parent A put a “hit out” on
Licensing Supervisor B.
 He asked Licensing Supervisor B why she would call him if he had a put a hit
out on her. He asked Licensing Supervisor B whether he had ever made
threats against her, and Licensing Supervisor B said, no. Licensing
Supervisor B reported she had no issues or concerns with him.
 Licensing Supervisor B, nor anyone else reported that Youth 1 was removed
from the foster home due to concerns of abuse or neglect.
 There is an active special evaluation against his home as of 7/8/2021, but that
is related to the 11year old and 15-year foster boys, who were placed in his
foster home getting into a fight. He affirmed that the agency would have been
concerned with supervision of those youths, which he indicated would not
have been an issue. He reported that Licensing Supervisor B denied to him
that Youth 1 removal was due to that special evaluation.
 He denied knowing why an Ennis Center for Children staff person would
report that he had threatened DHHS staff. He said if Ennis believed that, why
then would Ennis want him to take back Youth 2 who had been in respite and
was to return to his care. He advised Ennis he would not take Youth 2 back
into his foster home; but then that he could not do so due to advisement by
DHHS.
 He denied making threats against Licensing Supervisor B or any DHHS staff.
 He believes Youth 1’s removal was due to him threatening to transfer his
license. He said, he, his mother, and a few others are the only shelter beds in
Wayne County and Licensing Supervisor B has threatened to tear up their
contracts for not answering their phones. The morning of Youth 1’s removal
from his home, he told Licensing Worker E he was transferring his license. At
2:00pm Licensing Worker E texted him to inquired as to who are the youths
4

placed in his care, then at 8:00pm Youth 1 was removed. Youth 1 was upset
and crying at the removal.
 He never received or asked for anything in writing related to the reason for
Youth 1’ removal.
 A family team meeting (FTM) has not occurred since Youth 1’s removal.
 He did not request a foster care review board review and denied being
advised of the possibility. He said prior to Ennis emailing Licensing
Specialist D of him allegedly threatening Wayne County DHHS-NC agency
staff, the DHHS-NC had not reported a concern with him.
On 8/4/2021 I reviewed the email and written documentation Chief Administrator 0
provided related to the reason for Youth 1’s removal from Foster Parent A’s home.
Chief Administrator 0 email indicated:
 Youth 1 was replaced after hours due to explicit threats made by Foster
Parent A to DHHS staff and a staff at Ennis Center.
 They replaced Youth 1 in the evening and then Licensing Supervisor B
contacted Foster Parent A on the next business day. Licensing Supervisor B
advised Foster Parent A that the threat was the reason for youth 1’s
replacement.
 Chief Administrator 0 sent Foster Parent A a zero-tolerance letter.
 A complaint was filed by DHHS-NC staff with Gibraltar Police Department.
Chief Administrator 0 attached the letter and information his department provided to
Gibraltar Police. It included a statement from Placement Specialist G and Ennis Center
Staff Person X regarding Foster Parent A’s s behavior and his derogatory and
inflammatory comments. The referenced documents were:
 Placement Specialist G’s statement, which was from an incident report written
pertaining to an incident on 7/6/2021. That statement/incident report narrative
alleged what Foster Parent A reported to Placement Specialist G. This incident
report included sexual threats towards the husbands and sons of workers, and
other derogatory statements. This included alleging that he had a gun, (carry).
 Ennis Center Staff Person (ECSP) X’s statement, which was from a 7/29/2021
email sent to Licensing Specialist D. ECSP X had a foster child in Foster Parent
A’s home. The email indicated:
 “I do have concerns with Foster Parent A’s thought process in thinking that
everyone is fearful of investigating his home. He has claimed on multiple
occasions that he has many contacts through DHHS and CPS, and no one
investigates him because they know how he runs his home. He also reports
to carry a gun into DHHS when he comes in? My other concern was that on
07/09/2021, when I did my well child check on CD, Foster Parent A stated
that he had threatened to beat up a licensing worker in the past when she
was investigating his home, and he stated a few minutes later into the
conversation.”
 Chief Administrator 0’s letter to Foster Parent dated 7/30/2021 which indicated”
5

 Dear Foster Parent A,
“This letter is in response to verbal threats on Wayne County
MDHHS employees on 7/6/2021 and 7/9/2021. It is reported
on both dates that you described an explicit act of harm to
MDHHS staff. As a result of these threats, this matter has
been referred to the Gibraltar Police Department for further
investigation.
The Department of Human Services attempts to provide
services to our foster parents with dignity and respect.
Likewise, we expect your visits to our office and/or
interaction with staff to be mutually respectful. This includes
any telephone conversations and/or any face-to-face
contacts. If you should be required to visit one of our
MDHHS Child Welfare offices, I would respectfully request
advanced notice of your visit via telephone at 313-852-1708.
MDHHS has a Zero Tolerance policy for actual or
threatened violence.
PROHIBITED THREATENING BEHAVIOR INCLUDES:
 Engaging in any threatening or assaultive behavior.
 Engaging in behaviors, which cause another to feel
terrorized, frightened, or intimidated.
 Any threat to do harm to another person or property.
All reported threats or incidents of violence will be
investigated. The Department will presume that any threat
made will constitute a statement of intent to do harm.
MDHHS will prosecute individuals who violate the Zero
Tolerance standards to the extent permitted by law.
It is our desire to continue to provide services to you and
your family, we therefore, ask that you be mindful of our
Zero Tolerance policy when you visit a county office of the
MDHHS or in your future contacts with MDHHS staff.”
Chief Administrator 0 also reported conferencing this matter with Lansing Consultant
XX.
On 8/9/2021 I spoke with ECSP X. ECSP X confirmed the information Chief
Administrator 0 reported that ECSP X provided by email. Additionally, ECSP X
acknowledged she had a foster child in Foster Parent A’s foster home. ECSP X
reported information as reported by Foster Parent A related to a physical altercation
6

occurring between Youth 3(age 15) and the child under her agency’s care, Youth
2(age 11). The physical altercation resulted with Youth 2 needing medical attention.
ECSP X made a home visit to Foster Parent A’s home on 7/9/2021 related to that
physical altercation incident. At that home visit, Foster Parent A voiced statements
about DHHS-NC. Foster Parent A reported DHHS does not investigate him,
because they know how he runs his home, and they are fearful of losing his home.
Foster Parent A said he carries a gun when he visits DHHS, and in the past he
threatened to beat up a licensing worker who was investigating his home; and the
licensing worker quit. Additionally, that he is not above paying someone up to
$10,000 for an address. Foster Parent A did not elaborate on the statement related
to paying for an address, but Foster Parent A made that comment when he was
talking about threatening the licensing worker. Foster Parent A was talking very fast
when he made those statements. After this incident, ECSP X shared the information
Foster Parent A reported with her supervisor, but not DHHS. She provided the
information to Licensing Specialist D on 7/29/2021, after Licensing Specialist D’s
7/28/2021 email to her asking whether ECSP X had any information and or concerns
related to Foster Parent A. ECSP X emailed Licensing Specialist D back on
7/29/2021 indicating her concerns with Foster Parent A’s “thought process”, and the
information as outlined in her email, as described earlier in this report.
ECSP X was not aware of Youth 1’s removal until Foster Parent A informed her on
8/2/2021. She affirmed Foster Parent A’s reporting that Youth 2 had been on respite
and was due to return to Foster Parent A’s home. She was trying to facilitate Youth
2’s return when Foster Parent A advised her DHHS-NC said he could not take Youth
2 into his home. On 7/29/2021 Licensing Supervisor B advised her Youth 2 could
not return to Foster Parent A’s home due to concerns of poor supervision in Foster
Parent A’s home.
On 8/11/2021 I interviewed Licensing Supervisor B by telephone. I also had email
contacts/ information from her after 8/11/2021, as indicated earlier under the
methodology section of this report. Licensing Supervisor B reported a letter
notification was not sent to Foster Parent A explaining why there was a placement
change. The explanation occurred verbally. She telephoned Foster Parent A on
7/30/2021. She explained why Youth 1’s removal took place and reminded him he
had a special evaluation already open. She told Foster Parent A concerns had
come up that he had made threats against DHHS -NC employees. She said, she
knew Foster Parent A was angry at her, and she asked him whether he had made
threats against her. He denied making threats. She never told him that she knew he
had not threatened her.
Licensing Supervisor B reported the threat allegations by Foster Parent A came by
way of a 7/6/2021 incident involving Placement Specialist G, and an email from
ECSP X to the licensing specialist on 7/29/2021 Licensing Supervisor B reported
there was no agency movement on the 7/6/2021 incident report because she had
not taken it seriously; and there was no threat of harm until notification of the
7/29/2021 email from ECSP X. With regards to the 7/6/2021 incident, Licensing
7

Supervisor B reported Placement Specialist G told her what happened, that Foster
Parent A “was being nasty”. She advised Placement Specialist G to complete the
incident report. She spoke with Placement Specialist G’s immediately supervisor the
next day and that supervisor reported she would follow up on the matter.
On 8/11/2021 I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) C by telephone. FCW C
reported not being apprised of or given notice of anything related to Youth 1’s
removal until after the fact. She received an email the next day saying he was
replaced. She spoke with Foster Parent A the next day after Youth 1’s removal and
Foster Parent A reported not receiving notice either. She sent an email to Licensing
Supervisor B asking about Youth 1’s emergency removal after he was just placed in
Foster Parent A’s home on a permanent bed yesterday. FCW C reported she had no
information on the abrupt removal and asked to be filled in so that she could provide
clarify for herself and Youth 1’s mother as to whether this placement is no longer
available.
FCW C reported she did not do an official family team meeting or DHS-69 for Youth
1’s placement change. She was trying to find out the issues. FCW C reported not
being apprised of the allegations of threats to departmental staff until just recently,
after she sought answers.
On 8/31/2021 I interviewed Licensing Specialist D by telephone. Licensing
Specialist D reported Foster Parent A never asked her why Youth 1 was replaced
from Foster Parent A’s home.
Reviewed
 Youth 1’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
 Youth 1 was placed in Foster Parent A’s foster home on 7/14/2021.
 Various social work contacts to/from and by various DHHS-NC staff on
7/29/2021 related to the need to complete an emergency removal of Youth 1
from Foster Parent A’s foster home. Of the need to not give Foster Parent A
notice of the move or reason for the removal; to use on-call children services
to conduct the replacement; of efforts made to place Youth 1 at the Wolverine
Shelter; that the police accompanied the on-call worker for Youth 1’s removed
from Foster Parent A’s home. That the replacement and transport of Youth 1
went without incident, but Youth 1 was visibly agitated from being removed.
That the on-call worker was to advise Foster Parent A to contact the foster
care worker for details about the removal and reason for it the next day.
Youth 1 was placement at Wolverine Shelter.
 The reason for Youth 1’s replacement was not documented in his MISACWIS
file.
 No documentation of an FTM or DHS-69 prior 8/11/2021.
 Placement Specialist G’s statement/ incident report pertaining to an incident
on 7/6/2021.
8

 Copy of the email FCW C sent to Licensing Supervisor B on 7/30/2021 asking
about Youth 1’s removal from Foster Parent A’s home, the viability of the
placement. Also Licensing Supervisor B’s reply to her on 8/2/2021, which was
that Foster Parent A was undergoing an investigation on very serious
allegations against him. Youth 1 was removed for his safety, as well as the
safety of any DHHS specialists who must go to his home.
 Foster Parent A’s MISACWIS case record as outline later in this report.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(I) That the current foster parent was notified in writing
of the following information:
(i) Not less than 14 calendar days in advance, of the
change, except when prior notification would jeopardize the
child’s care or safety. If prior notice is not provided, then
the agency shall notify the foster parent, at the time of the
change, why prior notice was not given.
ANALYSIS: The foster parent was not provided prior notice of the change of
placement on 7/29/2021 due to safety concerns, an allegation of
threat of harm towards agency employees had previously been
made by the foster parent.
A verbal explanation as to why the youth was replaced from the
foster home was provided to the foster parent via telephone by
the licensing supervisor on 7/30/2021. Given the nature of the
safety concern, in this instance, the verbal explanation meets
the intent of this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
The agency failed to provide the foster parent with appropriate complaint information
or schedule a timely interview since the initiation of the special evaluation on
7/8/2021. The foster parent is seeking information on the status of his license and
has received no response.
INVESTIGATION
On 8/2/2021 and 8/4/2021, I spoke with Foster Parent A. Foster Parent A reported
knowing a special investigation had been initiated against his foster home. He
reported there is an active special evaluation against his home as of 7/8/2021,
related to his 11 year and 15-year foster boys getting into a physical fight. He
9

affirmed that the agency would have been concerned with supervision of the youths,
which he indicated would not have been an issue. He did not report a concern with
the agency not contacting him for an interview.
On 8/11/2021 I interviewed Licensing Supervisor B by telephone and had email
contacts with her as indicated earlier in this report. Licensing Supervisor B reported
Foster Parent A was provided information about the nature of the allegation against
him with respect to the 7/8/2021 special evaluation by Licensing Specialist D.
Licensing Supervisor B reported after the initiation of the first special investigation,
and prior to this complaint against DHHS-NC, Foster Parent A did not contact her
related to the status of his license. He contacted her by email on 8/20/2021. She
provided me a copy of that email from him that indicated:
 He wanted to know when they were planning on coming out to do the
interview for him. “because different agency wanted to place there kids in the
home in I told them I am still Under investigation. In that I am Cooperating to
get it done because I no there are looking for home for teenagers boys. Also
I still have a child in Residential in his mother stated that she would like him
place back in the home because he getting An patient there because he want
to come back. I am not trying to rush no one. But I feel bad for him being
there in he was doing good in my home.”
Licensing Supervisor B reported Licensing Specialist D would have had follow up
contacts with Foster Parent A. Licensing Supervisor B reported, she contacted
Foster Parent A on 7/30/2021 and explained why Youth 1’s removal took place; and
she notified Foster Parent A that he was on a special evaluation as they had
additional findings. She informed him Licensing Specialist D would be contacting
him.
On 8/31/2021 I interviewed Licensing Specialist D by telephone. She was assigned
the first special evaluation for Foster Parent A on 7/8/2021. She contacted Foster
Parent A by telephone on 7/13/2021 and gave Foster Parent A the description of the
allegations against his foster home and the foster home rules the allegations related
to. She told him the special evaluation had to do with the fight that occurred with
youths in his home, and whether there was proper supervision during that time. She
did not send him a letter outlining those things. A follow up letter is not something
they do. She scheduled interviews for him and others in his home for 7/15/2021.
She interviewed him on 7/15/2021, at which time she told him he could have a third
party there prior to his interview and she reminded him of the allegations. She
reported that prior to DCWL’s receipt of the complaint this special investigation
relates; Foster Parent A contacted her once about the status of his license. Foster
Parent A texted her on 7/28/2021 asking for an update and she replied back to him
that same date. She has had other contacts with Foster Parent A since related to a
second special evaluation pertaining to his foster home. This second special
evaluation was initiated on 8/11/2021 with respect to alleged verbal threats to
DHHS-NC staff by Foster Parent A. Licensing Specialist D reported this second
special evaluation was not initiated sooner, because Licensing Supervisor B and
10

Chief Administrator 0 had been meeting about the matter and Licensing Supervisor
B was communicating with DCWL as to whether the alleged verbal threats by Foster
Parent A could be rolled into the 7/8/2021 special evaluation or whether a new
special evaluation needed to be opened. On 8/11/2021, Licensing Supervisor B
informed her they needed to open a second special evaluation and to contact Foster
Parent A. Licensing Specialist D telephoned Foster Parent A that same day and
informed him of the allegations to this second evaluation, and that she would contact
him later.
Reviewed
Foster Parent A’s MISACWIS provider file which showed the following contacts by
Licensing Specialist D:
 Information as reported by Licensing Specialist D related to her telephone
contact with Foster Parent A on 7/13/2021 and home visit to Foster Parent
A’s home on 7/15/2021.
 Licensing Specialist D spoke with Licensing Worker E about an open special
evaluation and putting Foster Parent A’s home on hold until the special
evaluation was completed.
 Licensing Specialist D received an email from Foster Parent A on 7/28/2021
stating "Hello just want an update. They have a kid that they want me to take.
 Licensing Specialist D contacted Foster Parent A back by text on 7/28/ 2021
and advised him of the following “This special evaluation was assigned to me
on 7/08/2021. We have approximately 45 days to complete the investigation
and submit results. I am currently still investigating this matter. I will be
reaching out to you soon with more questions and an update on the
investigation. If you have anything else to share regarding this case, please
feel free to give me a call. Unfortunately, while this investigation is still
pending you are unable to take placement of any new youth."
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(2) An agency shall inform foster parents of all of the
following before they are questioned or interviewed
regarding a special evaluation.
(b) a clear description of the allegations.
11

ANALYSIS: The foster parent was provided a clear description of the
allegations, interviewed timely and given updates on the status
of the special evaluation. The foster parent, as well as, the
licensing specialist who informed the foster parent of the
allegation descriptions and updates, both acknowledged that the
special evaluation related to a physical altercation between two
youths who were placed in Foster Parent A’s foster home and
whether there was proper supervision occurring.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION
Foster Parent A reported a family team meeting (FTM) has not occurred since Youth 1’s
removal
INVESTIGATION
I interviewed FCW C on 8/11/2021. FCW C reported she did not complete a formal
FTM. She and her supervisor had a telephone case conference with Foster Parent A
and Youth 1’s parent related to the fact the replacement had occurred. FCW C reported
not having clear details around the reason for Youth 1’s removal, but they discussed the
matter, and she sought to obtain further details.
MISACWIS documentation showed FCW C was advised not to give Foster Parent A
forewarning of Youth 1’s 7/29/2021 removal. Additionally, that the on-call staff were to
advise Foster Parent A to contact the foster care worker for details about the removal
and reason for it the next day.
A follow up review of MISACWIS by me after 8/11/2021 showed FCW C documented
her contact with the parties on 7/30/2021 as an FTM. The social work contact entered
on 8/11/2021 indicated:
 An ‘Impromptu FTM” was held with FCW C’s supervisor, Foster Parent A,
and Youth 1’s mother via telephone.
 Youth 1 was removed from Foster Parent A’s home with no notice and Foster
Parent A came to the office to speak to Chief Administrator 0. At that time,
an FTM was held with all parties via phone and face to face with worker and
supervisor. FTM document uploaded indicated: Youth 1 remains removed
today and Foster Parent A and Youth 1’s mother both asking why. However,
the worker and supervisor had very little information to provide. New
placement is still being sought out.
 Youth 1 was placed in Wolverine shelter. Licensing worker and supervisor
were asked for answers.
APPLICABLE RULE
Contract Policy Family team meeting.
FOM 722-6 B

INVESTIGATION
On 8/11/2021 I interviewed Licensing Supervisor B related to the initial complaint
allegations. During Licensing Supervisor B’s interview; as wells from an incident report
document provided by Chief Administrator 0 on 8/4/2021, it showed Foster Parent A
had made prior threats similar to what ECSP X reported to Licensing Specialist D on

The incident report completed by Placement Specialist G for an incident on
7/6/2021 indicated possible threats of harm from Foster Parent A and concerns
related to his conduct. This incident report indicated the incident occurred at
approximately 5:15 on 7/6/2021 and listed it as a “Assault- Verbal threat”.
 The incident report listed the location of the incident as “over the phone”.
 The incident report indicated it was forwarded to local management for
administrative or disciplinary investigation and to the police, but not when either
occurred.
Licensing Supervisor B reported Placement Specialist G told her what happened with
Foster Parent A on 7/6/2021. That Foster Parent A was “being nasty”. Licensing
Supervisor B advised Placement Specialist G to complete the incident report. She
spoke with Placement Specialist G’s immediate supervisor about the matter the next
day. Licensing Supervisor B reported not taking the matter seriously at that time. It was
only after the 7/29/2021 email from ECSP X to Licensing Specialist D that a special
evaluation was initiated.

referenced 7/6/2021 incident with Foster Parent A, as referenced elsewhere
